com.ibm.xmi.framework
Class FactoryRegister

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.xmi.framework.FactoryRegister
public class FactoryRegister
extends java.lang.Object

The framework uses this class to obtain an instance of a class that implements the Factory interface. You may call the registerFactory method to register your own Factory instance with the framework. The default factory is an instance of the FactoryAdapter class.

Method Summary
static Factory getFactory()
          Obtain an instance of a class that implements the Factory interface.
static void registerFactory(Factory f)
          Register an instance of your own class that implements the Factory interface, so future calls to the getFactory method return your factory rather than the default one.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

getFactory

public static Factory getFactory()
Obtain an instance of a class that implements the Factory interface. If you don't register your own factory, an instance of the FactoryAdapter class is returned.
Returns:
An instance of a class that implements the Factory interface;

registerFactory

public static void registerFactory(Factory f)
Register an instance of your own class that implements the Factory interface, so future calls to the getFactory method return your factory rather than the default one.
Parameters:
f - An instance of a class that implements the Factory interface
